titleInfo.title: STANDARD MERGER AND ACQUISITION REVIEWS THROUGH EQUAL RULES ACT OF 2015

name.namePart: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

extension.searchTitle: STANDARD MERGER AND ACQUISITION REVIEWS THROUGH EQUAL RULES ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 46

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Standard Merger and Acquisition Reviews Through Equal Rules Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 2745, to amend the Clayton Act and the Federal Trade Commission Act to provide that the Federal Trade Commission shall exercise authority with respect to mergers only under the Clayton Act and only in the same procedural manner as the Attorney General exercises such authority, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 171 noes, Roll No. 137.

congCommittee.name: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
Oversight and Government Reform

titleInfo.title: CONDEMNING THE TERRORIST ATTACKS IN BRUSSELS

extension.searchTitle: CONDEMNING THE TERRORIST ATTACKS IN BRUSSELS; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 46

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Condemning in the strongest terms the terrorist attacks in Brussels on March 22, 2016, which murdered more than 30 innocent people, and severely wounded many more
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and agree to the following measure:<P/>H. Res. 658, condemning in the strongest terms the terrorist attacks in Brussels on March 22, 2016, which murdered more than 30 innocent people, and severely wounded many more, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 409 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 138.
